title: Wim Hof Method: Activate Your Full Human Potential
author: Wim Hof

quotes.quote: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't, you're right.
Because the cold is merciless but righteous, we can learn from it. And what it shows us is that we have an innate capacity to deal with stress.
quotes.note: Cuando uno se enfrenta al frío extremo, y se despierta ese rechazo natural —grabado en nuestros instintos— que se puede asociar con el miedo a la muerte, y se traciende la sensación del dolor, se experimenta un tipo de libertad que es difícil de describir con palabras. En mi caso fue el silencio absoluto, cuando salí del agua helada, tomé un respiro profundo y todo lo que me estaba acomplejando, doliendo, o preocupando, dejó de estar ahí... ese tipo de incomodidades se disuelven en el frío.

quotes.quote: The Jews have a term for it, «tikkun olam». It means that we bear a responsibility not only for our own moral, spiritual, and material walfare, but also for the walfare of society at large.
quotes.note: This is something my father once thought me as a child. In different terms —never mentioned the jews haha—, but with the same meaning. And is the reason that I have to go back to Colombia. Not because of love, but because of a deep sense of responsability.
